title: RPG Mage

steps.hint: We're going to make a Mage character for an RPG game so first we need to set the scene, we'll use the darken function to change the color teal to a more suitable shade of dark blue - **type** `background darken teal,15 `
We're making pixel art so we'll turn the stroke off - **type** `stroke 0`
Let's set the color to saddlebrown for her hair - **type** `color saddlebrown`
We'll use the moveTo function to move the cursor to a specific canvas coordinate - **type** `moveTo 120,80`
We're going to draw the hair first so we can layer the rest of the character over it to create depth - **type** `rectangle 320,400`
We're going to be drawing with blocks 20 by 20 pixels big - **type** `move 20,-20`
Stack up another layer of hair - **type** `rectangle 280,20`
Move upwards again to create a rounded effect - **type** `move 20,-20`
Draw the final row of hair in - **type** `rectangle 240,20`
Next we'll draw the face, - **type** `color sandybrown`
Move the cursor to the top corner of where the face will be - **type** `move 0,120`
Draw the face with a `rectangle` that is 240 by 140
The face is a little too square so move the cursor up to the forehead - **type** `move 80,-40`
Draw another rectangle to create a fringe - **type** `rectangle 80,40`
Move the cursor down the face - **type** `move -40,180`
Finish the face off by drawing a chin - **type** `rectangle 160,20`
Next we'll draw some robes, our mage specialises in water magic so we'll make them blue - **type** `color paleturquoise`
Position the cursor for drawing the sleeves  - **type** `move -100,20`
Draw a `rectangle` 360 wide and 80 tall for the robe sleeves
Position the cursor to draw the body of the robe - **type** `move 60,80`
Draw a `rectangle` 240 wide and 100 tall for the robe body
Next we'll draw a seam on the robe, change the `color` to teal
Move the cursor to the middle of the robe - **type** `move 120,-80`
Draw a thin rectangle for the seam - **type** `rectangle 40,180`
Next up we'll draw the arms - **type** `move 140,40`
Change the `color` back to sandybrown
Draw the arm with a `rectangle` 40 by 140
Move to the the other side of the body - **type** `move -380,40`
This arm will be disconnected at first but don't worry, we haven't finished yet - **type** `rectangle 40,100`
Every mage needs a staff to cast magic, so we'll draw that next - **type** `color darkmagenta`
Move to the top of the staff - **type** `move 60,-120`
Draw the staff over the arm so it looks like it's being held - **type** `rectangle -40,220`
As we said at the start our character uses water magic so set the color to aquamarine - **type** `color aquamarine`
Draw an orb at the top of the staff, if we use negative numbers then shapes are drawn backwards - **type** `square -80`
We're also going to draw a magic circlet, move to the forehead - **type** `move 60,-200`
Draw a `rectangle` that is 240 by 20
Shift down a row on our grid - **type** `move -20,20`
Finish off the circlet - **type** `rectangle 280,20`
We just need to finish off the face so position the cursor over the eyes - **type** `move 60,60`
Set the `color` to black
Draw the eyes long and thin - **type** `rectangle 40,80`
Move across for the other eye - **type** `move 120,0`
Draw the other eye - **type** `rectangle 40,80`
One last detail, we're going to make the eyes shiny - **type** `color white`
Draw a smaller rectangle within the pupil - **type** `rectangle 20,40`
Move to the other eye - **type** `move -120,0`
Finish off with one last rectangle - **type** `rectangle 20,40`

completion_text: Well done! Your mage is ready to raid some dungeons and cast some spells. Why not change the colours of the outfit to red for fire magic.

#### What youâ€™ll hack
This is a much more intricate drawing, so there are many more things to change. You can go through the colours making up the image and change them to a new palette, and add in new objects. Take a look at the warrior and the lightning mage as ways of powering up your warrior with new powers, armour and weapons.

#### Briefing
The simple shapes you have been putting together into simple designs can be refined and brought into more complex creations. This RPG Mage is a much more intricate design, but uses just the same tools to create them.
